website_summaries.verdict: Tops our list for performance, looks, customer service. You won't find a better pair with more to offer for your active lifestyle.
pros: Guaranteed fit, attractive style, and graduated compression
Comfortable for most, and they tend not to fall down
cons: A few reports of holes and tears with normal use
The material can be warm in hot weather

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this awhile ago. ***ONLY WORN 3 TIMES*** 1. I wore at TOUGH MUDDER 2. Wore hiking - 1 mile hike 3. Wore at Joshua Tree - 1/2 day FLAT hikes On my THIRD wear - I realize that BOTH of my sock bottoms are entirely holey. When you first receive it - you won't notice anything off. It is 'good' quality feel/look. I really liked the compression part of it - but the bottom portion was VERY poorly made... So disappointed this happened on my THIRD wear. I don't wear it ALL the time. - and this happened...
customer_reviews.author: PeterVannika

customer_reviews.title: Not just for runners.
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a runner. Rather I am a guy who has to wear compression socks. If you have ever seen the cheap socks they sell for leg compression you'll understand that I wanted something warm, and thick for colder months. I was skeptical about the L sizing fits 11 through 13. I am a large WIDE footed 13, and have very large calves compared to most. They went right on. I wore them all day, and to bed that night. Woke up with skinny ankles, which was my hope. So I rather like these socks, and closer to winter will likely buy more pairs. Thanks MudGear folks....
customer_reviews.author: George P. West

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the pink
customer_reviews.text: Generally I love mudgear socks. But these I did not. Hands down mudgear makes the best socks for spartan/tough mudder races. But these pink socks show nothing but white strings when pulled on. I have big calves I’m an active person, but these things are designed to fit a person with stick for legs. The black version of these socks does not show white when over my calves. I was so excited for the pink color but sadly will be sending them back for the plain old black.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nye

customer_reviews.title: OCR Socks Are Here!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're running through the mud, trampling down trails, or simply out chewing up miles on the road these compression socks will be the second most important piece of equipment you put on. With ideal padding, incredible support, and lasting comfort these MudGear's do not disappoint. This is my second pair so far and I have absolutely been impressed with how well they hold up to the rough treatment dished. At the end of every race I simply spray down with a garden hose and then into the wash machine. I really don't notice any shrinkage or loss of composure. I bought mediums and typically wear size 9-91/2 running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Mud Run Leg Magic
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the Spartan Sprint and will use again for the Tough Mudder. I only trained in these a few times, but noticed a huge difference. I'm a newb so my first Terrain Race was an awful experience (on the job training) and I learned what not to do for the Spartan. The compression sock part is super to run in and really helps when you are exhausted. The length was a leg saver helping for rope climbing and anything else that involved legs rubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic socks and company!
customer_reviews.text: I have been running Spartan races with these socks since 2015. I never have to worry about the condition of my feet or getting leg cramps with them. I've run back to back beasts and they hold up to the torture, mud, water, rope climbs, more mud, and thorn bushes. I had a small issue with a new pair I purchased after two races, they developed a hole in the heel. I contacted MudGear, and they stood behind their motto of making their gear to last and sent me a new pair. Great company and great socks, I recommend them for any OCR event.
customer_reviews.author: vfireman72

customer_reviews.title: Worthy investment for Spartan/OCR racers
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited to my 4th Spartan race to buy these! I previously ran 3 Spartans without any socks. Very pleased with the compression/support of my calves, which felt great during the race, as well as ability to drain water quickly. I was worried they'd retain mud, but turned out not to be the case. Also, my feet didn't feel grit and gravel like they did when I ran without socks. Great product, won't do a Spartan race without them again. Seem durable as well. Came out of the wash looking brand new.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martel

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Quality, Support and Comfort here's why....
customer_reviews.text: These are some serious socks. You have to be patient getting them on and taking them off so you don't accidently weaken the composition. They take a beating, wash well and stay up. The compression and sock is one of the best. I've tried several other brands: Athletic Over the Calf Compression Crew Socks, Darn Tough Hojo OTC, Darn Tough Merino Wool Alpine (they are always ankle bound), and Vitalsox Patented Recovery Graduated Compression Socks. The only other sock that compares to these MudGears are Bridgedale's.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Tough socks in tough terrain
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for support to my calves after knee surgury. I experienced swelling with concurrent calf pain along with injury on rocks in muddy, rocky, tough terrain. The socks gave me all day support on the trail, protected my shins on slips and falls in 93 degree weather. I stayed cool, comfortable and dry. I did experience a hot spot on the ball of one foot. I normally don’t experience blisters or hotspots with thicker wool blend socks. I added a few strips of leukotape on vulnerable areas and no issues since. The socks are also great for recovery and if you follow cleaning instructions, they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Hyperion Sturm

customer_reviews.title: A must for the Tryolean Traverse! Extremely well made sock.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a Spartan Beast because I knew the Tryolean Traverse was an obstacle on that course, and boy did these come in handy. An absolute must for that obstacle. Simply holding down the sock so it's only about halfway up your calf so you have double layers of the sock for the Rope to Glide over without feeling anything. Simply pull yourself and let the Rope ride on the sock , no need for that monkey technique wasting all that energy. I wear a size 11 shoe in the large fit absolutely fine and very comfortable. Will buy these again if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great Compressin socks
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to not like about these socks. They perform well are comfortable and deliver what they promise. The only thing that is annoying about these socks is their price. I purchased several pairs of compression socks ranging from $6 - $30 per pair and I could not tell the difference in comfort or performance. I would appreciate the manufacturer or the retailer to tell me why the price is so high on these socks and what may I be missing because at the moment I don't see it.
customer_reviews.author: pilotski

customer_reviews.title: Expensive trash
customer_reviews.text: I wore them once, which would be fine if they cost $1. However, I expected a lot more for more than $20. They worked fine the one time, but tore immediately after the first wash. As soon as I tried to put them on
customer_reviews.author: Victor1212

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love these! But not durable
customer_reviews.text: Man, outta the package, these things are amazing. They hug you so perfectly that you forget they're on. They look good, feel good, probably even smell good...but, performance-wise...not so much. 1 tough mudder (walking) and 3 hikes, and they have holes everywhere. Contrast that to my $20 compression socks that have been on lots of adventures and still don't have a single hole. Super bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: As goos as all the reviews out there state....
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing. They fit perfect. I actually like that they are not as restrictive as some other brands I have tried (2XU and CEP for example). They allow for comfortable muscle contraction while running so they are socks I can actually wear throughout a long run and not feel "restricted" muscle pumping and movement. They ARE compressing enough that you sill get the benefits of a graduated compression garment however and I love them for this. Just received them so not sure about durability but the feel, thickness and construction of them make me have no doubts. Thanks Malko!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Staci F.

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I give these 4 stars, it is because of the high price. They are one of my favorites. I have some that are too thin and I have to wear socks on top of them. Not with these. I use them for work and exercise. I have purchased 4 different kinds. Elimination of foot soreness works with all of them so shop around. All of them will feel tighter than regular socks, hence the compression. I have gotten used to them very easily.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Should have kept them on.
customer_reviews.text: Took them on a Spartan Ultra Beast. Took a long time to get on as they were super tight, maybe bought the wrong ones. Protected my lower legs from everything. They also compressed my caffs which helped me to go longer. They did get wet but still managed prevent blisters. Definitely will be buying them again as they kinda wore out during the run. Changed them out half way for clean, non mudgear socks. Should have kept them on. No 5 star due to how much effort was needed to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Co-worker of mine recommended these compression socks for sales conventions we work in ...
customer_reviews.text: Co-worker of mine recommended these compression socks for sales conventions we work in our booth and are on our feet all day. I have done two shows now wearing these socks and they have been remarkable in decreasing my lower leg and foot fatigue at the end of a long day of walking & standing. I highly recommend these compression socks for sports, hiking, work. Have to be patient putting them on and taking them off due to their compression features but well worth the effort!!
customer_reviews.author: AMZNlovah

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for Mud Races
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to participate in any mud races or obstacle course type, look no further. This are the socks you want. Wore them for Spartan Race Beast & Tough Mudder Full. I will never do another race without them. They still look and feel like new, still perfect compression through all the obstacles, mud, dirt and water. Made my legs and feet feel great, big difference between any other compression socks. Excellent quality overall!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mud Run Socks!
customer_reviews.text: I got these in a size medium and they fit perfectly! I wear a size 7-7.5 in women's shoes. I have 13 inch calves for reference. I think if I had got the size small, they would have been too tight. I wore these in my first Mud Run this weekend that was a 10k. They protected my calves well and actually my calves and shins aren't sore at all, which I would have expected! They had great drainage and I never got any rocks stuck in my socks or anything like that. They also provided the perfect amount of cushion. Seemed pricey, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: jnk

customer_reviews.title: Great socks. They are expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. They are expensive but worth it. Mine got a small hole after running a Spartan Beast, but they did their job and protected my legs from the rope traverse. I have a large scar on my left leg from a previous race with that obstacle. Not even a red mark with these socks. Compression quality was good and my legs felt great after going the 13 miles in the Beast. I will buy again after these pair wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Asher

customer_reviews.title: Great for trail running!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of long compression socks I have ever owned. I kick myself for waiting for so long. They go on tight and at first it feels a little weird, but i got used to them quickly. They are great to keep the grit and mud off your legs while running the trails. I have run 30 miles in the last week and I do feel like it makes a difference. Just bought a few more pair.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schiff

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Approved!
customer_reviews.text: One word...Amazing! I wore these yesterday for the first time for a Spartan Beast. I knew I'd made a good choice when I saw about 25% of the other Spartans wearing them too. I spent multiple hours and 13.8 miles going through water, mud,rocks, and all manners of terrain. These socks kept my feet comfortable and protected throughout the race. I still have a Spartan Sprint and Super to complete for my trifecta this year, and you'd better believe these will be coming with me! AROO!
customer_reviews.author: Elysa S.

customer_reviews.title: Great socks. Ran tough mudder, 2 Spartans, 1 terrain race, and 1 rugged maniac
customer_reviews.text: Great socks im on my 2nd pair. I was Not nice to the 1st pair and the heel began to wear out due to my forceful method of putting them on. WATCH THE VID TO PUT THEM ON. Great socks though, im excited to run my 3rd Spartan in my new pair. I will continue to buy these socks for as long as I can race. Tough mudder 10 miles. Spartan 5 miles next spartan 9 miles. Rugged manic 5k. And terrain race 5k.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jack WA

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: Great compression! They are my go to socks when I know I will be on my feet for a long time, working out hard or traveling Far distances in a car, train, plane. I will definitely be purchasing them again. The only negative is that sometimes the foot length in the sock doesn’t seem big enough. I get pressure on my toes when not wearing shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quite good for OCR Races
customer_reviews.text: Very good. They did tear when I took a fall in a recent Spartan race. They were much heavier than I expected, and was worried that their thickness would hold and keep more water than desired. However, I did not find that to be the case. I have recently had problems with my toes (chafing) in my trail shoes. I found that these socks did a lot to prevent any problems. I did get the smaller size, and was glad I did. They fit very tightly, but that's my preference for such races.
customer_reviews.author: KarlT

customer_reviews.title: Performed well in 1/2 on frozen dirt roads
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a half marathon I ran recently. Leading up to the race the course was dirt roads that were covered with snow in places that melted so muddy slushy so I bought these to go with my gore-tex shoes. Ended up dropping to 15 degrees the night before the race and froze it all up but still wore the socks and they felt great and performed well just didn't to get to put them through their paces. I gave a 5 based on this but I will update any future races that challenges the sock to its potential.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wylie

customer_reviews.title: No Cramping and Added Rope Climbing Protection!
customer_reviews.text: I run Obstacle course races and these socks are amazing for them. I especially like the added protection on the back calves for traverses and rope climbing. No cramping, but when wet and muddy...prepare for a fight to get them off! Also, hotel dryers will shrink them even on the lowest setting ;-(
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great for Spartan Beast
customer_reviews.text: Held up well during the WVA Spartan Beast. It fits snug on the foot with nice cushioning so I didn't get any blisters. They worked great on rope climb and traverse rope. It took a little while to get all the dirt and mud out of them but after washing them, they are still in perfect condition. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alice S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic socks and must have for OCRs!
customer_reviews.text: If you are running OCRs and don’t have these socks... you’re missing out. I swear by these and encourage all new racers to invest in them. They drain water super fast, have padding in all the right places (no blisters ever!!!), the extra padding on the back has saved me on Spartan’s Tyrolean Traverse and on nasty prickly trails, the compression keeps my legs feeling fresh... and if you have low arches the extra support in this area is fantastic. I’ve taken them through multiple OCRs and will not use another brand. Absolutely LOVE MudGear!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K & Mr. H

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ocr socks!
customer_reviews.text: Not my first time purchasing, so I knew what I was getting. They fit according to size chart, and need zero adjustments, even on longer ocrs like the 13+ mile Spartan Beast. Very comfortable. Keeps feet warm on cold days, but not hot on hot days. They won’t last forever, and seem to break down after 4 or 5 races, depending on conditions (lots of rocks/debris in shoes, and rope climbs), but I believe that is to be expected. I still believe they are a great product, and have referred them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Protects against elements and fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for my girlfriend who runs trail races. The trails get quite overgrown in the summer, briars, poison ivy, and such. The socks were purchased as protection from trail overgrowth, but offer much more. She ran 22 miles in those socks yesterday, and today remarked about how her legs were not sore or tight, as is the usual after such a day of running.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks for My tough Mudder
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as promised. I've only used the socks once for a recent 12 miler tough mudder and they held up great. Not sure why others have had pics posted that they were made poorly and were tearing. My co-worker has a pair that he has used for 7 tough mudders and they have lasted. The socks were a bit difficult to get off but that was expected since they are compression socks. Overall the quality of the sock is outstanding and I would recommend the brand to anyone who runs tough mudders, spartan races or trail running!! Great Sock!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lynn conklin

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These were game-changing for me! My legs and feet felt great after wearing these at the Killington Beast! The high sock protected my lower legs and ankles from rope burns and the usual scrapes. When both my socks and shoes were soaked after the swim, they didn't slide around and protected my feet from blisters! I have heard from a few other runners who have had issues with these socks coming apart, but after multiple races I have not experienced anything like that. I will be ordering a second pair soon because I will be running two races in two days and have no plans to run without them!
customer_reviews.author: David Adam Veling

customer_reviews.title: add some support to the heels and are great protection from rope climbs and traverses
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different compression socks for Spartan Races before and they all had some sort of problem. I wore these for the first time during a Spartan Beast and they performed amazingly! I will never race again without them. They support the calf's over the haul from craps, add some support to the heels and are great protection from rope climbs and traverses. Water drainage is as well as can be expected from compression socks. Get the large if you have decent calf muscles and know that they can shrink although this has not happened to me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Peltz

customer_reviews.title: ... for a couple of in town daily jogs and liked them, but then I wore them at the ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for a couple of in town daily jogs and liked them, but then I wore them at the Breckenridge Beast, and loved them. They really kept my calves in great shape throughout. Also the socks held up really well on the Tyrolian Traverse. Saw a bunch of other socks that got shredded but these held up well!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Lever

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because every time I fly, my legs and feet swell. Sometimes to the point it feels like they are going to split open. I wore these on our last flight out of country. I don’t need up wearing them for 12 hours that day. They were extremely comfortable the entire time, and I had no swelling, none. I hit recommend them if you suffer from adema, whether from travel, heart conditions, whatever.
customer_reviews.author: HuntandFishVATop Contributor: Beekeeping

customer_reviews.title: ... used for a Spartan Beast OCR and they did great. My co-runner
customer_reviews.text: Bought these specifically to be used for a Spartan Beast OCR and they did great. My co-runner, who did not have a pair of knee-high socks, got a hideous looking rope burn on one of the obstacles. I removed one star because when I first put them, pulling quite hard, it sounded like a few strands were giving way near the top. Other than that they felt great. Hope to use them again and see how they last.
customer_reviews.author: Nicodemus3

customer_reviews.title: You won't be sorry!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are quality all the way! Are they expensive? Sure, but you get what you pay for and cheap socks are no bargain on a long course! I have been using low rise MudGear socks for over a year now, and the 2 pair pack has lasted me through over 10 Spartan races and 5 Bonefrog/Savage/Mudder combinations. I love them, but needed some better shin protection and decided to try calf compression socks. I love the quality and fit, they feel incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my first Spartan Super Race at Palmerton
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my first Spartan Super Race at Palmerton. I have always had problems with my calfs cramping up and experienced no cramping during the race. This time my thighs cramped up so i guess i need to get some leggings next time. But honestly they were great. They stayed up, they compressed, and they felt food on my feet while going through the trails and obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Marley Burr

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little leery paying this much for socks, but well worth the money. I use them for 10K, 13.1 and all of my mud runs, and i have to say it does help with the calf issues on the longer runs. They are really useful on the Spartan runs with the rope crossing, and any run in the woods. I have bought two pair so that i have enough on the double weekend runs. Great socks!
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for flying long hauls
customer_reviews.text: Wore socks on a long flight to Brasilia (about 10 hrs) with layovers. I have done a lot of flying in my days and wish I had found compression socks earlier. Felt terrific, legs less stiff at end. First time I put them I could feel sturdy like they really were supporting my legs. Mud gear quality was excellent,lots of compression. Some work to put on but such relief flying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best socks for OCR or even trail running
customer_reviews.text: Put them through hell in the Spartan Sprint at Big Bear. Mud, snow, rain, wind, water hazards and dunk walls, obstacles, and rugged terrain never phased these socks. My feet/toes stayed warm through all of that. The compression is very comfortable and cushion in foot area is good, but not too thick. Definitely will buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Good Color
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a mud run and LOVED wearing these socks. I never had any issues with them falling down and cleaned up really well afterwards. My only con was the color in the photo vs reality. When you take them out of the box they look perfect but when you put them on a lot of white shows due to the stretch. I am a normal person and have normal calves so it was not due to a wrong size, just something to note when buying.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: my legs did not feel tired and sore like they usually do
customer_reviews.text: I am 46 and blood pools in my legs due to having POTS (Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome) which is a symptom of being born with Ehler's Danlos Hypermobility syndrome. I bought your compression socks because warm weather is around the corner and wearing compression pantyhose can be very hot. I wore your socks the day after receiving them promptly in the mail. They did not itch or feel hot at anytime of the day. I really didn't realize I had them on. That evening when I took them off, my legs did not feel tired and sore like they usually do. I probably felt like most people do without my syndrome. Thank you for creating this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and a great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second pair as my previous ones ripped during a race (I think I caught some low hanging barbed wire, so it's not a fault in the socks in any way - although that might be a matter of perspective ;) ). These socks are super comfortable and fit very well. They're snug all around, even around the toes - I had some other compression socks be oddly waaayyyyy too big there, and so they would feel awkward. They also retain the compression part very well, or at least better than some others I've tried. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gintas Zukas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome OCR socks
customer_reviews.text: Very supportive socks that drain really well and are surprisingly comfortable. I have very large calf muscles (22") and they fit over them and provide excellent support. Only wish they had a large foot size. I bought the Large size and my size 15 gun boats really push them to their stretching limit. I think an XL for feet 14-16 would be a nice addition to their lineup. Other than that I would highly recommend these socks to any Spartan or OCR racer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Sedam

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Have run 3 spartan races in these and love them. I have always run in super thin socks and was a little worried about running In these....not real thick but definitely thicker than I was used to. They worked perfect didn't have any blisters which is saying a lot for running 13 miles with wet feet the whole time!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good wet or dry, moderate protection from rope burn.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these for rope climbs at the gym. They certainly helped reduce burns higher on my lower leg, but they aren't quite thick enough to really protect you at the ankle joint. I wore them recently for compression and warmth at the GA SwimRun. Even after several swims they stayed in place, never moved and performed really well while wet. No blisters. Mine have a few runs in them from when I got a bit aggressive when trying to put them on, size 11.5 foot, would be five star if not for that.
customer_reviews.author: SVD

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: Just put these through the test in the Reebok Spartan Race Los Angeles Sprint this past weekend and they were AWESOME. These are NOT your normal compression socks. I was skeptical but can say that they're made with OCR racers in mind. They drained perfectly. They were padded in the right areas for obstacles like ropes and others. Oh, and they looked cool too. Not sure about the other products but MudGear nailed this one. If mine ever wear out, they'll most definitely be replaced with the same or whatever new version MudGear has developed.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, so so material
customer_reviews.text: So purchased these for riding since i didn't want to wear ugly plain compression socks on ride. These were good for about 3 wears before the seams started to split and fray. these socks cost just about as much as a standard pair of compression socks and with that price point i would expect them to last a bit more. There are techniques to put a compression sock on properly so you are not fighting them.
customer_reviews.author: Jens

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at tough mudder
customer_reviews.text: I wore these to my first Tough Mudder event and they were great. That was my first time doing the race, so I have no experience without the socks to compare it to, but I did not experience any cramping during the race nor any blisters from my shoes. After the race I put the socks in my washer and dryer and they came out very stiff but clean and re-usable. I don't know that these socks are any better than a cheaper brand, but if money is not an issue then definitely buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: I love my mudgear socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are the bees knees (err...or the beets feet?). I love my mudgear socks, and ordered this second pair because I run OCRs a lot, and wanted to make sure I have the best backup socks possible. Plus, I love that Malko (owner) sends out an email for every order. As a small company, they do an awesome job of making sure customers are happy, and getting legit quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Shivani Trivedi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, fit as expected, prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: I wear ladies size 7.5 shoe and I ordered a small sock and it fits great. Not as much padding in the back as I imagined but seems it will be plenty of protection. I would probably not like them any thicker. Liked them so much, I'm giving them as gifts. Wish they came in other colors besides orange and black, like maybe red/black or pink/black or better yet, purple/black. None the less; really like the socks.
customer_reviews.author: JBW

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are great compression socks!! They are very comfortable and they have great support. I had problem and they responded quickly and resolved my problem right away. Definitely a great buy on a great pair of compression socks! I just ran a hilly 20 miler and my calves feel great. I will be buying a black and green pair next:)
customer_reviews.author: JCFAN22

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Beast-worthy!
customer_reviews.text: Spartan Beast-worthy! After my last Spartan "Super" race I decided that I needed full compression coverage from my toes to below my knees. I wear a separate compression item for my knees. These worked perfect, protected my toes and never shifted position on my calf even when wet. They easily survived this 12.5 mile obstacle course and will be using them again and again. Totally worth what I paid for them. And, I just bought my second pair. I wear the first pair so much for regular working out that I needed another set.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the swelling down
customer_reviews.text: I'm recovering from a broken leg. Need to keep swelling down...friend gave me HER one sock to try out (she wears em on her frequent international flights). Really comfortable and well made. So I bought 2 pairs of my own!!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Renaud

customer_reviews.title: magic socks!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect with these socks, but as an avid member of the OCR community, I kept hearing about MudGear socks, so I had to try them. And OH MY GOD... I was not disappointed. My two miles this morning felt better than any I've run recently. I never felt any fatigue in my legs or feet, despite speeding up my mile time. The support in the legs and feet felt amazing, without any soreness. I can't wait to try these out on obstacles at my first OCR of the season next weekend!
customer_reviews.author: SpartanCouple

customer_reviews.title: They just feel good to have on when I work out, period.
customer_reviews.text: Loving my MudGear compression socks! I had a bad knee injury a few years ago and my lower leg still swells up after leg day...well...not now that I have my awesome MudGear compression socks! Also, I was developing shin splints, and these are helping keep that under control. Of course, the real test will come in about a month when I wear them in my first obstacle course race :) Thanks! Great fit, and so far, they seem like they are going to last well. They just feel good to have on when I work out, period.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Goes the distance
customer_reviews.text: I have used the same pair of these socks for 3+ years now averaging roughly 1x / month. I use them at the local park where the fields get pretty tall and the trails can get slightly overgrown. These socks are great for keeping the mud, briars, ticks and chiggers off.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan N Hardee

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy to say they passed test
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to run the 2016 Tough Mudder in AZ. These socks handled every obstacle!! Some of my fellow competitors wrapped duck tape around the tops of their socks in order to keep them in place. I skipped the tape to see if these socks would stay in place under the various conditions they were going to be put through. I am very happy to say they passed test!! I love these socks and will be wearing them for my next tough mudder and any other obstacle course race I do!! Best purchase I made for the race!! And FYI, I ordered a size large and they fit perfect! I wear a 10.5 shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Felixberto J Mendiola

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Tough Mudder!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these socks a while back, but wanted to wait until after my race to review them. This is my second year running Tough Mudder. We do the full 10 mile race. These socks are amazing! I had nice support on my calves during the whole race. They did not slip down and stayed put! They also didn’t hold extra mud or water (obviously I still had mud in the socks, and they were still wet, but I didn’t have huge clunks of mud in my aocks) I would highly recommend these to anyone doing a mud race!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: hard to get on and off, but i guess ...
customer_reviews.text: hard to get on and off, but i guess that's why the compression. They work, but my arms get a workout pulling them off.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: They feel great!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a bit additional support on long runs. First time out with the ran my longest run of 8 miles (not much bit some people's standard but my personal best) and i felt great. Could possible be all in my head but really bought them for protection during and obstacles race.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fontanet

customer_reviews.title: Spartan ready
customer_reviews.text: Loving these socks! Got a pair for myself and sister for our upcoming Spartan races. Will post update of performance after race. So far the fit is amazing, socks offer full range of protection up the calf and shin. Arch support feels just right and toe/heel are reinforced. The compression doesn't feel too tight and movement isn't restricted.
customer_reviews.author: Walk About

customer_reviews.title: These are the best compression socks I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of compression socks, these are by far the best. They are not as thin as the others I have had. I bought them about 6 weeks after I sprained my ankle for extra support when hiking and I was very impressed with them. I recently bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: margot

customer_reviews.title: You want these socks for your mud run
customer_reviews.text: These socks performed above our expectations. They were really good at keeping all the sand and grit out when I traversed through mud and water. I saw a lot of other runners wearing these socks, which was a huge confidence boost in my choice to purchase these socks. Always choose performance. The material is nice for running because they have great compression, too.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have worn them a few times for a run and I like them so far. The cushion on the foot seems good - toe and heel pads. The support is also snug. Still getting used to them but really liked the padding in the foot for running.
customer_reviews.author: vizman

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and underdelivered
customer_reviews.text: The fit and compression were fine (how hard is it for a sock to fit?) but the durability was sadly lacking. I tried wearing these for Spartan races and after only a couple they wore thin and then right through on friction points (heel, around the ankle where the top of the shoe is). They're rather hard to remove once wet and I ended up putting my thumb right through them after a race and threw them away. My replacement has been Darn Tough and they're still doing great on all fronts after multiple Spartan Trifectas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Spartan Socks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent socks for a Spartan race. I ran a Spartan in cool weather and these socks kept my feet warm, even when wet. They have good compression and padding in the feet, front shin part of sock. I wore these under compression pants and they did not feel heavy when wet. I wear a women's size 8/8.5 shoe size and purchased a size medium sock as noted on the MudGear website. I would recommend trying them out.
customer_reviews.author: Oenbrink

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I did a ToughMudder with these and they were great. I usually get calf cramps during the run but with these on (and running tights). I barely pulled a muscle. I would recommend these for working out and OCRs. I had an issue initially with them with a small hole but customer service was able to help me out!!!
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great OCR compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Look good, and provide great compression. There is extra padding on the calf and shin areas that protect you in OCR. Just make sure not to put them in the dryer when washing, they shrink and get hard. Air dry only.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fits Women's size 11 feet well
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'7" with size 11 feet and these fit me quite well. The band around the top of my calf was a bit too tight and left a red ring for 2 days, but I think this is because I hadn't stretched them out enough because the red marks went away after a few wearings.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Green

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Beast complete...LOVE THE SOCKS
customer_reviews.text: Just started using them and although I have not put them through an ultimate test with an OCR race, training in them feels great. They are supportive and I can feel the compression. I am really looking forward to using them in a race later this month. I am updating the original post since I have now been training in these socks for a little bit now. They are great socks. I will using them next weekend in a race and I can honestly say I am looking forward to it. UPDATE: NJ Spartan Beast completed in these socks...I love them!
customer_reviews.author: OCRJoe

customer_reviews.title: Great all around outdoor activity sock
customer_reviews.text: I love to hike and these are a great match to hiking boots. Great compression, padding on heels and toes. No hurtful seam on toes. Moisture wicking. Didn't overheat my feet on a hot day on the trail. I'm on the more "mature" spectrum of age, and they are great for me. I did accidentally dry them and thought I ruined them but they were just fine. I have around 15 pairs of compression socks and these are my favorite. I'm planning on trying them in my ski boots this winter and in my winter boots for snowshoeing. Cannot find any to say negative.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my first Spartan race and they turned out to be one of the best pieces of apparel that I used that day. Durable, comfortable, and protected by legs from brush/obstacles. Never once slide down on their own. Highly recommend these for Spartan races or races like those.
customer_reviews.author: megan shaw

customer_reviews.title: so I went with the smaller size sock thinking "well they're supposed to be nice and tight
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive, I wear a size 10 M shoe, so I went with the smaller size sock thinking "well they're supposed to be nice and tight, seeing as they're compression socks" but they were too tight. I only wore them once... very uncomfortable, was such a relief when I got home to take them off. Not sure if compression gear is worth the hype... I'll just stick to what i'm comfortable with.
customer_reviews.author: FlamSanagan

customer_reviews.title: Be delicate while dressing and you'll be happy!
customer_reviews.text: These would have been a 5 star except while putting them on I pulled them too hard and they ripped a little. Other then that they work amazing. I've hiked through mud and ran in these and no complaints. I have other compression socks that I pull really hard and never had a rip issue, so just be a little more delicate while putting on, compared to other running compression socks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Get for OCR!
customer_reviews.text: Ran a couple obstacle course races without compression socks and boy did they do the difference not only helped keep me warm but didn’t notice as much fatigue in my legs during big bear Spartan!
customer_reviews.author: Love Agne

customer_reviews.title: No more tired legs
customer_reviews.text: I love these compression socks. I’m on my feet all day and now that I have these socks, my legs aren’t nearly as tired. The fit is great. I’ve washed them about 5-6 times and they are holding up very nicely. I don’t dry them in the dryer. I hang dry. Great color choices.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sifrer

customer_reviews.title: ... is tough to leave one star as I really liked the socks for the 3 times I wore them
customer_reviews.text: This one is tough to leave one star as I really liked the socks for the 3 times I wore them. On the 4th time, I pulled them up and (they are snug - I am a size 9.5) they ripped on the seam from where the foot connects to the ankle piece. Unfortunately, this was about 5 minutes before a Spartan race and I had no option but to roll with them with the tear. It obviously didn't effect the race, but it was annoying nonetheless. I would not purchase these again with the price point and my experience with their durability.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wells

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Best socks! Wore these for an obstacle race and they were comfortable and I had no hotspots!!! Would definitely recommend! The race was 4.5 miles and our feet were wet before we ever got started!
customer_reviews.author: BVP

customer_reviews.title: Not just for mud runs!
customer_reviews.text: These are marketed to the mud run obstacle people mostly but I use them hiking, climbing, mountaineering etc. They are perfect for me with any shorts on to have on in cooler temps in the morning or when I'm going through trails where I need a little extra protection on the legs from brush, rocks if I'm scrambling any or whatever comes my way. If I'm in a more open area I can roll them down and catch a breeze to cool down and then go back at it. They fit as advertised for me and help keepmy feet blister free. They are high quality gear and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Spartan OCRs
customer_reviews.text: My husband used these in his first OCR thanks to the previous reviews and he loved them. No marks on his legs from the ropes. Provided a little extra grip when doing the rope climb and didn't hurt his skin. When he ran through the forest he didn't get little scratches on his legs as they were protected by the socks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Mahorn

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for myself thinking it would help with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself thinking it would help with a tendon issue in my outer foot. I found the socks too constraining. Then my son who is 17 and a triple jumper in track used them and LOVES them for jumping. So 5 stars from him - who is probably the true target user. thanks.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used them once so I will update after wearing them to the race. I bought them to use for Spartan race and I already trained with them. They are comfortable and stay in place, truly compression socks. My shins are not as sore as they usually are after doing an intense training session and I climbed the rope (kind off, still learning) and not one rope burn. I still have a month to go until the race will update as soon as I finished.
customer_reviews.author: ksj

customer_reviews.title: No Rope Burn!!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks were amazing! This is why: I was able to slide my legs with no burning or challenge at all on a hanging rope obstacle during a Spartan race. Several people on my team who had ankle socks got MAJOR rope burn. Not me thanks to my socks from MudGear!
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Seems worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for medical reasons - medium compression for circulatory skin discoloration from sit-down job all day. I don't wear them every day, but they seem to have helped, and they seem well made. I now have 3 pairs and may buy more!
customer_reviews.author: DRB/AMB

customer_reviews.title: great support
customer_reviews.text: Using the socks for trail runs - the first few times on shorter runs under 10 miles. Wore them on 5/11/19 for a 21 mile race - the support was excellent, no wear spots, good cushioning on heels and balls of feet. Only tiny complaint was the elastic band at the top were a bit tight - left a slight abrasion on the back of my upper calf (and I have very skinny legs, wearing a medium for a women's size 9). Still, I definitely recommend them and will continue to sue them for shorter and longer trail runs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hoekstra

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I ran my first Spartan Race Beast in these, and although the race was the toughest thing I've ever done, these made it better. I had read that you shouldn't drag your legs on the traverse because even with good socks you burn your ankles, but I had no choice and it didn't hurt at all. They dried out well, too. I ran a couple miles with pebbles in my shoes and I was sure that I would have holes in these socks but they held up. I'd definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Can't even get my foot into it
customer_reviews.text: People obviously love these socks, but I can't even get them on, and I have normal size legs. I tried the method shown on the site, but no luck. Bummer. Back they gol.
customer_reviews.author: Riolama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Since these were my first compression socks, I had a couple of questions. The folks at MudGear are incredibly responsive! (Thank you MudGear, for your quick response!) If this is your first time also, MudGear has a great video demonstrating the "heel pocket method" for putting them on. This is definitely the way to go if you want to avoid frustration. If not, you can find yourself fighting a loosing wrestling match while putting them on. As compressiin socks, the are tight by design.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is my first MudGear compression sock purchase and I love them! I am not a athlete. I work outside and I am on my feet all day. I get on average 17,000 steps at work each day. I have started wearing compression socks I thought it would be good for me down the road. MudGear is by far the best I have purchased well worth money. Will again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running compression socks! 🏃
customer_reviews.text: Although I have several other brands (CEP, SLS3 & Zenash) these are as good or better overall. Fit right (large) as I'm a size 11 & are not difficult to get on or off. Spandex helps along with nylon to make them breathable & not heavy. Solid value and just the right amount of compression without feeling tight! 😉
customer_reviews.author: David Weeks

customer_reviews.title: I won't run without them again
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for the first time in the 2017 US Spartan Winter Race at Greek Peak with a pair of Inov-8 talons. I am pretty sure they are the main reason I still have toes since it was roughly 4° on the mountain that day. I put these over a pair of regular rebok cotton ankle socks for extra protection from the elements and my feet stayed very warm the entire race. I even ran through muddy watery terrain up to my shin and at the end of the race the mud had turned to ice, literally freezing my shoes onto my feet! But my ankles and feet were protected and not phased due to the socks. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Crystal L Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Spartan
customer_reviews.text: I've had some trouble with my calves cramping during exercising a lot more recently. I've had other compression socks that I tried using for mud races and they ended up being really uncomfortable. These socks were the complete opposite. They kept wicking moisture away, and were thick enough that even the finest sediment from the course didn't really make it through (a problem I've had with other compression socks in the past). My feet were damp by the end of the race (8.5 miles in the rain, constant ankle deep mud), but the socks remained pretty comfortable considering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them already
customer_reviews.text: So I decided to go trail running on a wet snowy day and boy did the mudgear socks I owed do their job. I currently have the 3/4 one which kept my feet warm and comfortable so much so that I purchased the high ones for OCR season. Look no further and don't buy another paireason because the perfect socks are here
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: My socks arrived yesterday and they fit great and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My socks arrived yesterday and they fit great and are very comfortable. I got them for an OCR in September, so I haven't run with them on yet, but I plan to have a few test runs before my race. So far they feel great though. I will also say that the customer service from this company has been excellent! I have received follow up correspondence from them to ensure I got the socks, they sent a mudrun guide and a quick video on the best way to put on the socks to ensure a good fit and long sock life. I highly recommend this company & sock!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, but appears to be wearing out sooner rather than later
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these only a few times (about 10-12 times), and they are very snug fitting and especially tight pulling them over the heel of the foot. I've noticed that the heel area on both pair are already wearing out. Slighting disappointed with that. Overall they feel good and prevent my legs from feeling fatigued during training runs. I've run two Spartan races so far with these (Sprint and Super) and have not had any issues with my legs so far.
customer_reviews.author: EEreader

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have for OCR runners!
customer_reviews.text: I loved my MudGear socks so much I bought another pair before actually using them in a real race. I have since run a Spartan Sprint wearing them and I couldn't be more impressed. Today in fact I ran a 7 mile trail run near my home, and train the way you play, right? Pulled my socks up and hit the path. I was nervous about getting compression socks... Not "manly" enough. But, shut up! I love my MudGears!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fitzy

customer_reviews.title: Compression Socks made for warriors
customer_reviews.text: Someone recommended these for the recent Warrior Dash that I ran. And let me tell you they were great. They were comfortable for compression socks. They were durable, provided protection from the obstacles and best of all they helped me recover quicker.
customer_reviews.author: MR

product_meta.title: MudGear Premium Compression Socks - Mens & Womens Running Hiking Trail (1 Pair)
feature_bullets: LIFETIME WARRANTY - Our premium compression running socks are made so well that we guarntee you will be completely satisfied with them. They're built tough in the USA for men and women competing in outdoor performance sports like Spartan Race and Tough Mudder, but comfortable for hiking, climbing, rucking and all-day wear by military, police and rescue workers, nurses, and other everyday warriors. Knee high with padded calf.
SUPER COMFORTABLE - Built to provide comfort, wick water better than wool, and prevent blisters over long miles. These compression running socks are built to last.
TRUE GRADUATED COMPRESSION - Reduce muscle fatigue and boost circulation. Performance grade rated at 15-20 mmhg and often used for medical support and relief.
SPEEDS RECOVERY - Stabilize muscles and recover faster. Padded toe box, over and under. Armor up for all competition. Also excellent for soccer, motorcross, ski, and hockey.
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED - Conquer obstacles with MudGear.
